key.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: a small specially shaped piece of metal that you put into a lock and turn in order to lock or unlock a door, start a car etc
key.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: A bunch of keys hung from his belt.
I can lend you a spare key to the store until you get one cut  (=made).
key.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: the buttons that you press on a computer keyboard to operate the computer
key.translation[0].definitions[1].note.t: hot key/shortcut key (=a special key on a computer, that does specific things)
key.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: the wooden or metal parts that you press on a piano and some wind instruments in order to play them
key.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: a scale of notes that begins with one particular note, or the quality of sound this scale has
key.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: a tune in the key of A minor
key.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: a list of the signs, colours etc used on a map or technical drawing etc that explains what they mean
key.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: the printed answers to a test or set of questions in a book
key.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: a small flat island, especially one that is part of a group near the coast
key.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: Never hide your spare key under the doormat.
I’ll get a new door key cut for you.
She left her car keys on the hall table.
She felt in her pocket for the front door key.
Sam turned the ignition key and drove slowly away.
He took out a huge bunch of keys and unlocked the door.
Has anyone seen the key to the garage door?
put a key in a lock/the door
I put the key in the lock, but it wouldn’t turn.
She inserted the key into the lock.
He climbed into his car and turned the key.
Could you get a key cut for me?
He walked off down the corridor, jangling his keys.
The largest key unlocks the front door.
We heard the key turn in the lock.
key.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: China’s support is key to the success of the coalition.
The president makes all the key decisions on foreign policy.
The show has been hit by the departure of key personnel.
key.translation[1].note_box[0].sections[: a key factor
A key factor in starting any business is its location.
a key element/feature/component
Advertising is a key element in the success of a product.
a key role
Sanders played a key role in the team’s winning season.
a key area
What are the key areas of economic policy?
a key issue/question/point
The environment became a key issue during the election.
a key figure
She was a key figure in the election campaign.
a key player
He won’t leave key players out of the team.
a key witness
She will be a key witness in the murder trial.
a key decision
Women made most of the key decisions about how money was spent in the household.
a key word
Once you know the key words, you can make your own sentence.
key.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: if you key a win for your team, you help it win a game because you play very well
key.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: Abdul keyed the game with three touchdowns.
key.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: to prepare a surface so that a covering such as paint will stick to it
key.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: a part of a computer with a letter, number etc on it that you press with your fingers to make it work
key.translation[3].definitions[1].defini: the part of a plan, arrangement etc that is the most important and which everything else depends on
key.translation[3].definitions[1].exampl: The key to customer satisfaction is quick access to those best placed to resolve issues quickly.
If managers are free to concentrate on the core business, this could be a key to economicsuccess in the difficult times ahead.
key.translation[4].definitions[0].exampl: the impact of foreign investment onkey industries
The key elements of Japanese management methods can be applied to Western organisations.
A key factor in these companies’ success is knowing their customers’ preferences.
Technical alliances between companies are key to putting pressure on other cable competitors.
key.translation[4].definitions[1].defini: a person or company that is very important and influential
key.translation[4].definitions[1].exampl: The key players involved in the change must be identified and their commitment to the change obtained.
Employers are key actors within industrial relations.
key.translation[5].definitions[0].defini: if the level, price, value etc of something is keyed to something else, it is related to it and rises and falls with it
key.translation[5].definitions[0].exampl: In many cases, brokers’ commissions are keyed to share prices.
The agreement requires banks to hold a certain amount of capital, keyed to the riskiness of loans.
